text: John Wilden Hughes, Jr. (February 18, 1950 â€“ August 6, 2009) was an American filmmaker. He was born in Lansing, Michigan. He grew up in Grosse Pointe, Michigan and Northbrook, a suburb of Chicago, Illinois. He died of a heart attack in Manhattan, New York City. Hughes' movies include: National Lampoon's Vacation, Sixteen Candles, The Breakfast Club, National Lampoon's European Vacation, Weird Science, Pretty in Pink, Ferris Bueller's Day Off, Some Kind of Wonderful, Planes, Trains and Automobiles, She's Having a Baby, The Great Outdoors, Uncle Buck, National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation, Home Alone, Career Opportunities, Only the Lonely, Curly Sue, Beethoven, Home Alone 2: Lost in New York, Dennis the Menace, Baby's Day Out, Miracle of 34th Street, Lovers in Las Vegas, 101 Dalmatians, Flubber, Home Alone 3, Just Visiting, Maid in Manhattan and Drillbit Taylor. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1950 births Category:2009 deaths Category:American television writers Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Movie directors from Chicago Category:Movie producers from Chicago Category:Movie directors from Michigan Category:Movie producers from Michigan Category:People from Lansing, Michigan Category:People from Grosse Pointe, Michigan Category:Screenwriters from Chicago Category:Screenwriters from Michigan
